metadata.source: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
metadata.part: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
metadata.section_title: Person intending to establish themselves in business

chunks.text: ### Person intending to establish themselves in business
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals intending to establish themselves through self-employment or business activities. Applicants must demonstrate a genuine intention and the ability to set up a viable business, with specific thresholds for funding and experience; exceptions may apply based on individual circumstances.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
Part: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
Section ID: SW 3.1
Section: Person intending to establish themselves in business
Topic: business

Summary: This provision applies to individuals intending to establish themselves through self-employment or business activities. Applicants must demonstrate a genuine intention and the ability to set up a viable business, with specific thresholds for funding and experience; exceptions may apply based on individual circumstances.

### Person intending to establish themselves in business

204.DELETED

It requires applicants to demonstrate their intention and ability to set up and run a business, with specific eligibility criteria and conditions for entry. Exceptions or additional requirements may apply based on individual circumstances.

metadata.section_title: Innovators

chunks.text: ### Innovators
chunks.summary: Innovators must demonstrate a genuine, viable innovative business idea and meet specific criteria, including endorsement by an approved body. They must also satisfy the English language requirement and the maintenance funds threshold, with certain exceptions for applicants endorsed under specific schemes.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
Part: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people
Section ID: SW 3.1
Section: Innovators
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Innovators must demonstrate a genuine, viable innovative business idea and meet specific criteria, including endorsement by an approved body. They must also satisfy the English language requirement and the maintenance funds threshold, with certain exceptions for applicants endorsed under specific schemes.

### Innovators

metadata.section_title: Leave to enter as an innovator

chunks.text:
### Leave to enter as an innovator

210B. DELETED
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals seeking leave to enter as innovators under the UK immigration rules. Applicants must demonstrate they intend to establish a new or develop an existing business with genuine innovation, scalability, and viability, meeting specific criteria. Critical conditions include meeting the eligibility requirements, providing credible evidence of their business plans, and fulfilling any specified thresholds.

chunks.text: ### Requirements for an extension of stay as an investor
chunks.summary: This provision applies to investors seeking an extension of their stay under the UK Immigration Rules. metadata.section_title: Writers, composers and artists

chunks.text: ### Writers, composers and artists
chunks.summary: This provision applies to writers, composers, and artists seeking entry or stay under UK immigration rules. They must demonstrate relevant expertise and produce evidence of their work's impact or significance. No specific exceptions are detailed in this excerpt.
chunks.augmented_text:

Part: Immigration Rules part 6: self-employment and business people

Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to writers, composers, and artists seeking entry or stay under UK immigration rules. They must demonstrate relevant expertise and produce evidence of their work's impact or significance. No specific exceptions are detailed in this excerpt.

### Writers, composers and artists

Summary: This provision applies to writers, composers, and artists seeking leave to enter the UK. They must meet specific criteria outlined in the rules, with certain paragraphs now deleted or superseded, requiring applicants to refer to Appendix F for current requirements and conditions.

### Requirements for leave to enter the United Kingdom as a writer, composer or artist

1.   232. Deleted on 30 June 2008 by paragraph 17 of Statement of Changes HC 607 except insofar as relevant to paragraph 238. Please see Appendix F for the wording of these Rules in a case in which they are relevant.

chunks.text:
### Refusal of leave to enter as a writer, composer or artist

1.   234. Deleted on 30 June 2008 by paragraph 17 of Statement of Changes HC 607 except insofar as relevant to paragraph 238. Please see Appendix F for the wording of these Rules in a case in which they are relevant.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to writers, composers, and artists seeking entry. It delineates the refusal grounds, now largely deleted, with exceptions in Appendix F, emphasizing eligibility criteria and specific conditions for entry clearance. Critical thresholds or detailed criteria are outlined elsewhere in related appendices.
